Luis Serrano, Universidad Pública de Navarra (UPNA), lserrano@unavarra.es
José Andonegui, Hospital de Navarra, jose.andonegui.navarro@cfnavarra.es

Lamirel C, Bruce BB, Wright DW, Delaney KP, Newman NJ, Biousse V. Quality of nonmydriatic digital fundus photography obtained by nurse practitioners in the emergency department: the FOTO-ED study. Ophthalmology. 2012 Mar;119(3):617-24. doi: 10.1016/j.ophtha.2011.09.013. Epub 2012 Jan 3. PubMed PMID: 22218140; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC3294008.
Grading diabetic retinopathy from stereoscopic color fundus photographs--an extension of the modified Airlie House classification. ETDRS report number 10. Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study Research Group. Ophthalmology. 1991 May;98(5 Suppl):786-806. PubMed PMID: 2062513.
Li HK, Horton M, Bursell SE, Cavallerano J, Zimmer-Galler I, Tennant M, Abramoff M, Chaum E, Debuc DC, Leonard-Martin T, Winchester M; American Telemedicine Association Diabetic Retinopathy Telehealth Practice Recommendations Working Group., Lawrence MG, Bauman W, Gardner WK, Hildebran L, Federman J. Telehealth practice recommendations for diabetic retinopathy, second edition. Telemed J E Health. 2011 Dec;17(10):814-37. doi: 10.1089/tmj.2011.0075. Epub 2011 Oct 4. Review. PubMed PMID: 21970573.
Aitor Eguzkitza, Universidad Pública de Navarra - Complejo Hospitalario de Navarra, aitor.eguzkiza@unavarra.es

This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyrighted material of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Where an implementation of this artefact makes use of SNOMED CT content, the implementer must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/get-snomedct or info@snomed.org.

details.purpose: Para registrar detalhes sobre o resultados clínicos do exame fundoscopia dos olhos.
To record details about clinical findings on fundoscopy of eyes.
Registrar los detalles durante la adquisición de imágenes de fondo de ojo
details.use: Descripción de los hallazgos durante la captura de imágenes de fondo de ojo así como los hallazgos clínicos obtenidos a partir de estudiar estas imágenes.

translations.author: Aitor Eguzkitza
Universidad Pública de Navarra - Complejo Hospitalario de Navarra
aitor.eguzkiza@unavarra.es

items.items: *Record of clinical findings on fundoscopy of eyes.(en)
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.(en)
*Identification of the eye which is being examined.(en)
*Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination of the eye examined.(en)
*Method chosen to perform the funduscopic examination.(en)
*Study of eye fundus by indirect ophthalmoscopy method.(en)
*True if during the acquisition, pupil diameter is smaller than normal (3,3mm).(en)
*True if cataract obstructs the visualization of eye fundus.(en)
*True if shadow artifact is present on the border of the image.(en)
*Levels quantifying the quality of each acquisition, based in the ease to visualize the structures on the eye fundus.(en)
La calidad de la imagen no alcanza los criterios mínimos para diagnóstico
Incapacidad de distinguir todos los hallazgos fundamentales
En la imagen se aprecia la estructura del fondo de ojo, sin embargo, no es posible distinguir hallazgos clínicos
Sólo es posible distinguir los hallazgos fundamentales
Es posible detectar signos útiles para diagnóstico, pero se escapan los mas sutiles
La calidad no es ideal, pero es posible identificar algunos hallazgos sutiles

Es posible identificar hallazgos sutiles de interés diagnóstico, pero la calidad de imagen aún podría ser mejor. Suele darse este caso en imágenes periféricas o que implican dificultad, que han sido capturadas correctamente.
Imagen ideal en la cual es sencillo identificar hallazgos de interés clínico. Suele darse este caso en imágenes directas obtenidas correctamente.
*Describes the optical acceptance angle of the lens used during the test.(en)
*30º angle used for small pupil (SP) capture (for patients with pupil diameter <3.3mm).(en)
*45º angle used to acquire eye fundus of normal pupils.(en)
*Number of attempts before obtaining the acquisition (doesn't compute if test is repeated by a specific recognized technical failure).(en)
*Subdivision of the retina identifying eye fundus image locations.(en)
*Subdivision of the retina based on Diabetic Retinopathy Study fields.(en)
*Division of the retina in quadrants + mosaic obtained from the combination of them.(en)
*Mosaic obtained from combining every peripheral acquisitions and the center one.(en)
*Image centered on the optic nerve or papila.(en)
*Image centered on the temporal quadrant of the retina.(en)
*Image centered on the superior half of the retina.(en)
*Image centered on the inferior half of the retina.(en)
*Details of the device used to acquire eye fundus images.(en)
*60º angle used to acquire eye fundus in some DR screening studies.(en)
*True if the refraction of the eye exceeds the range from -12D to +15D.(en)
*True if patient doesn't collaborate during the image acquisition.(en)
*Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.(en)
*Observation of retina through funduscopic images acquired by previous dilatation of patient's pupils.(en)
*Observation of retina through funduscopic images acquired without previous dilatation of patient's pupils.(en)
*Eye fundus viewing through biomicroscopy lens in contact to patient's eye surface.(en)
*Eye fundus viewing through biomicroscopy lens without contact to patient's eye surface.(en)
*Observation of the eye fundus using a fluorescent dye inyected to emphasize the blood vessels in the eye retina.(en)
Detalles en cuanto a los resultados de la prueba de exámen del fondo de ojo para cada ojo.
Se ha observado el ojo izquierdo
Se ha observado el ojo derecho
*Additional structured details about the physical examination findings.(en)
*Narrative description of factors, not recorded elsewhere, that may influence the clinical findings.(en)
*Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.(en)
*Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings for the eye examined.(en)
*Coding of the 'Clinical interpretation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.(en)
*For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.(en)

Record of clinical findings on fundoscopy of eyes.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Identification of the eye which is being examined.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination of the eye examined.
Method chosen to perform the funduscopic examination.
Study of eye fundus by indirect ophthalmoscopy method.
True if Red Reflex is present.
True if during the acquisition, pupil diameter is smaller than normal (3,3mm).
True if cataract obstructs the visualization of eye fundus.
True if shadow artifact is present on the border of the image.
Levels quantifying the quality of each acquisition, based in the ease to visualize the structures on the eye fundus.
Quality inadequate for any diagnostic purpose
Unable to exclude all emergent findings
Only able to exclude emergent findings
Quality not ideal, but is possible to exclude subtle findings
Describes the optical acceptance angle of the lens used during the test.
30º angle used for small pupil (SP) capture (for patients with pupil diameter <3.3mm).
45º angle used to acquire eye fundus of normal pupils.
Number of attempts before obtaining the acquisition (doesn't compute if test is repeated by a specific recognized technical failure).
Subdivision of the retina identifying eye fundus image locations.
Subdivision of the retina based on Diabetic Retinopathy Study fields.
Division of the retina in quadrants + mosaic obtained from the combination of them.
Mosaic obtained from combining every peripheral acquisitions and the center one.
Image centered on the optic nerve or papila.
Image centered on the temporal quadrant of the retina.
Image centered on the superior half of the retina.
Image centered on the inferior half of the retina.
Details of the device used to acquire eye fundus images.
Narrative description about the optic disc.
Narrative description about the retinal arteries.
Narrative description about the retinal veins.
Narrative description about the retinal background.
Narrative description about the vitreous humour.
60º angle used to acquire eye fundus in some DR screening studies.
True if the refraction of the eye exceeds the range from -12D to +15D.
True if patient doesn't collaborate during the image acquisition.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.
Observation of retina through funduscopic images acquired by previous dilatation of patient's pupils.
Observation of retina through funduscopic images acquired without previous dilatation of patient's pupils.
Eye fundus viewing through biomicroscopy lens in contact to patient's eye surface.
Eye fundus viewing through biomicroscopy lens without contact to patient's eye surface.
Observation of the eye fundus using a fluorescent dye inyected to emphasize the blood vessels in the eye retina.
Details of the funduscopic examination test result for each eye.
Additional structured details about the physical examination findings.
Narrative description of factors, not recorded elsewhere, that may influence the clinical findings.
Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.
Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings for the eye examined.
Coding of the 'Clinical interpretation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
